title: Retro Model Railroads
description: All aboard! Test your knowledge of the classic hobby of model railroading from its golden era.

questions.question: Which iconic American company was best known for its O-gauge model trains and became synonymous with model railroading?
What gauge did American Flyer trains famously use, which featured more realistic two-rail track?
What does 'HO scale' stand for in model railroading?
Which popular magazine, first published in 1934, became the go-to publication for model railroad enthusiasts?
What was the traditional setting for many family model train layouts, especially around the holidays?
Which German company, known for high-quality HO scale trains, was a favorite among serious modelers?
What material was commonly used to create realistic mountains and terrain on model railroad layouts?
What was a 'transformer' used for in model railroading?
options: Controlling the speed and direction of trains

questions.question: Which affordable brand of HO trains, sold in department stores in the 1960s-70s, was many children's introduction to the hobby?
What did modelers call the miniature non-moving people, animals, and vehicles placed on layouts for realism?
What type of small trees were often made using lichen, a dried natural material, on vintage layouts?
Which track configuration allows a train to turn around and go back the way it came?
What was 'ballast' on a model railroad?
options: The base board of the layout
Crushed stone material spread between and around the track ties

questions.question: Which classic Lionel accessory featured a small building where a man would pop out to receive or deliver mail bags from passing trains?
What organization, founded in 1935, is the largest model railroad group in the world?
